page.title: 01INTRODUCING AYLESBURY
page.content: In the very centre of Buckinghamshire,the {Vale of Aylesbury} stretches across rich farming country from remote Otmoor on the west to the high {Chilterns} escarpment above Ivinghoe and Pitstone to the east.In the south of the District is the busy town of Aylesbury,the administrative centre for both the District and the shire and an industrial and commertial centre of importance .In the north is the historic town of Buckingham and the great estate of Stowe. The District has {interesting villages} and beautiful country houses.The area is farmed successfully,and features {modern industry} and tourist attractions.
